Trade/Device Name(s): BD Phoenix™ Automated Microbiology System - Ampicillin-sulbactam
BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System for use with the antimicrobial agent ampicillin-sulbactam (1/0.5-32/16 μg/mL)
Regulation Name(s): Fully Automated Short-Term Incubation Cycle Antimicrobial Susceptibility Devices
Specimen Type(s): Pure culture of most aerobic and facultative anaerobic Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria of human origin
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System panels with ampicillin-sulbactam for automated antimicrobial susceptibility and identification testing of bacterial isolates
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for rapid identification and in vitro quantitative antimicrobial susceptibility testing (MIC determination) of Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria isolates from pure culture, including Enterobacteriaceae, Non-Enterobacteriaceae, Staphylococcus, Enterococcus, and Streptococcus, using Phoenix panels containing ampicillin-sulbactam
